generations.summary: The first generation MDX was a mid-size luxury SUV based on the Honda Pilot platform. It featured a 3.5L V6 engine and offered standard all-wheel drive.
The second generation MDX grew in size and power, with a 3.7L V6 engine. It also received updated styling and technology features.
The third generation MDX introduced a new design and a more luxurious interior. A hybrid variant was added in later years.
The fourth generation MDX features a new platform, updated styling, and a more powerful engine. It also includes advanced safety and technology features.
The original NSX was a groundbreaking sports car, featuring an all-aluminum body and a mid-engine layout. It was known for its exceptional handling and reliability.
The second-generation NSX was a hybrid supercar, featuring a twin-turbocharged V6 engine and electric motors. It offered impressive performance and advanced technology.
The first generation RDX was a compact luxury SUV, featuring a turbocharged 2.3L inline-four engine and standard all-wheel drive.
The second generation RDX received a new design and a more fuel-efficient 3.5L V6 engine.
The third generation RDX features a new platform, a turbocharged 2.0L inline-four engine, and a more luxurious interior.

cons: Infotainment system can be slow (older models)

generations.summary: The first generation TL was a mid-size luxury sedan known for its performance and value. It offered a choice of V6 engines and available manual transmission.
The second generation TL featured a more aggressive design and offered a more powerful engine option. It also introduced Super Handling All-Wheel Drive (SH-AWD).
The third generation TLX was a compact luxury sedan, replacing the TL and TSX. It offered a choice of four-cylinder and V6 engines.
The fourth generation TLX features a new platform, a more refined interior, and a turbocharged engine. It also offers a Type S performance variant.

cons: Infotainment system can be complex (older models)

generations.summary: The Giulia marked Alfa Romeo's return to the mid-size sedan segment. It features a sporty design and performance-oriented engines.
The Stelvio is Alfa Romeo's first SUV, offering sporty handling and performance in a compact package.
The DB11 marked a new era for Aston Martin, featuring a modern design and advanced technology. It offered powerful engine options and luxurious interiors.
The DBX is Aston Martin's first SUV, combining luxury, performance, and practicality. It features a powerful engine and a stylish design.

Second generation X1, with a more spacious interior and updated technology.
Third generation X1, with a new design and available electric powertrain.

The Bugatti Chiron is a mid-engine two-seater sports car developed and manufactured by Bugatti Automobiles S.A.S. It is the successor to the Bugatti Veyron. The Chiron is based on the same platform as the Veyron, but features a redesigned body, more powerful engine, and updated technology.

The DM-i series represents BYD's plug-in hybrid technology, offering excellent fuel efficiency and electric range.

The second generation Qin evolved with updated styling and powertrain options, including all-electric versions.
The Seagull is a compact electric hatchback, designed for urban driving and affordability.

cons: Limited range compared to larger EVs

The second generation introduced hybrid options and updated styling.
The third generation Song expanded its powertrain options to include plug-in hybrids and electric versions.
The Song DM-i Sedan is a plug-in hybrid sedan, offering a blend of fuel efficiency and electric driving.

generations.summary: The original Caterham Seven, based on the Lotus Seven. Offered with various Ford engines.
Continued the evolution of the Seven, with refinements and engine updates.
Further development with more engine options and chassis improvements.
Continued with various engine options, including Ford and Caterham's own developments.
Continues the Seven's legacy with various engine options, including Ford and Caterham's own developments. Continues to evolve with new models and special editions.

Improved design and features compared to the first generation. Facelifted in 2017.

The first generation of the Tiggo, a compact SUV. Facelifted in 2009 and 2013.
A redesigned Tiggo with updated styling and features. Facelifted in 2019.
The current generation, featuring a modern design and advanced technology. Includes Tiggo 7, Tiggo 8 and other variants.
The first generation Camaro was a pony car introduced to compete with the Ford Mustang. It offered various engine options, from inline-sixes to powerful V8s.
The second generation featured a longer, wider body and a more aggressive design. Engine options included a variety of V8s, with performance varying throughout the years due to emissions regulations.
The third generation saw a move to a more modern design with fuel injection and improved aerodynamics. Performance varied, with the IROC-Z being a notable high-performance variant.
The fourth generation Camaro featured a new body style and improved performance. The LT1 and LS1 V8 engines were highlights.
The fifth generation brought back the retro styling and offered a range of engines, including a V6 and powerful V8 options. It was built on the Zeta platform.
The sixth generation Camaro moved to the Alpha platform, offering improved handling and performance. Engine options included a turbocharged four-cylinder, a V6, and a V8.
The first generation Corvette was introduced as a fiberglass-bodied convertible. It featured inline-six engines initially, later transitioning to V8s.
The second generation, known as the 'Sting Ray', introduced a new design and improved performance. It included the iconic split-window coupe in 1963.
The third generation featured a distinctive 'shark' body style. Engine performance varied over the years due to emissions regulations.
The fourth generation brought a more modern design and improved handling. The introduction of the LT1 engine in 1992 was a significant performance upgrade.
The fifth generation featured a new chassis and the LS1 engine, offering improved performance and refinement.
The sixth generation featured updated styling and the LS2, LS3, and LS7 engines. The Z06 and ZR1 models offered high-performance variants.
The seventh generation introduced a new design and the LT1 engine. The Z06 and ZR1 models continued to push performance boundaries.
The eighth generation Corvette marked a significant shift with a mid-engine layout. It features the LT2 engine and offers exceptional performance and handling.
The first generation Equinox was a compact SUV based on the Theta platform. It offered a comfortable ride and decent cargo space.
The second generation Equinox featured updated styling and improved fuel efficiency. A diesel engine option was available for a few years.
The third generation Equinox is a more modern and stylish compact SUV. It offers a range of turbocharged engines and updated technology features.
The first generation Malibu was a mid-size car offered in various body styles. It was known for its stylish design and available V8 engines.
The second generation Malibu featured a new body style and continued to offer a range of engine options, including powerful V8s.
The third generation Malibu was larger and heavier. Engine options were affected by emissions regulations.
The fourth generation Malibu was smaller and lighter. A diesel engine was offered for a short period.
The fifth generation Malibu was a front-wheel-drive mid-size sedan. It was based on the GM N platform.
The sixth generation Malibu featured updated styling and a new platform. It offered improved safety features.
The seventh generation Malibu offered a more refined design and a hybrid version. It was built on the Epsilon platform.
The eighth generation Malibu featured a new design and improved fuel efficiency. A hybrid model was available.
The ninth generation Malibu offers a modern design and a range of engine options, including a hybrid. It is built on the E2 platform.
The first generation of the Chrysler 300 brought back the classic American sedan style with a focus on luxury and performance.
The second generation refined the design and offered updated technology and engine options.
The Chrysler Crossfire was a sporty coupe and roadster based on the Mercedes-Benz SLK platform.
The Chrysler Pacifica is a modern minivan offering a comfortable interior, advanced technology, and a plug-in hybrid option.
The Chrysler PT Cruiser was a retro-styled compact car that offered a unique design and versatile interior.

The first generation Challenger was a pony car, offered with a wide variety of engines, from a 225 cu in (3.7 L) slant-6 to a 426 cu in (7.0 L) Hemi V8.
The second generation was a rebadged Mitsubishi Galant Lambda.
The third generation Challenger is a retro-styled muscle car, based on the LX platform shared with the Charger. It offered powerful V6 and V8 engines.
The first generation Charger was a mid-size muscle car, known for its fastback styling.
The second generation Charger featured iconic styling, including the 'Coke bottle' shape and hidden headlights.
The third generation Charger was redesigned with a more rounded body style.
The fourth generation Charger was a downsized coupe, based on the Chrysler Cordoba.
The fifth generation Charger was a compact hatchback, based on the Chrysler L platform.
The sixth generation Charger was a full-size sedan, based on the LX platform.
The seventh generation Charger continued the full-size sedan design, with updated styling and engine options.
The first generation Durango was a mid-size SUV, based on the Dodge Dakota pickup truck.
The second generation Durango was redesigned with a more modern look and improved features.
The third generation Durango is based on the same platform as the Jeep Grand Cherokee, offering a more refined driving experience.
The first generation Grand Caravan was one of the first minivans, offering a spacious and practical design.
The second generation Grand Caravan featured updated styling and improved features.
The third generation Grand Caravan offered more safety features and a more powerful engine.
The fourth generation Grand Caravan introduced Stow 'n Go seating.
The fifth generation Grand Caravan continued to offer Stow 'n Go seating and a variety of features.
The Dodge Journey was a compact crossover SUV, offering available third-row seating.
The first generation Viper was a raw, powerful sports car, known for its large V10 engine and aggressive styling.
The second generation Viper featured updated styling and a more powerful engine.
The third generation Viper was redesigned with a more modern look and improved features.
The Dongfeng H30 is a compact car produced by Dongfeng Motor. It is based on the Peugeot 307 platform.
The Dongfeng T5 is a compact SUV produced by Dongfeng Motor. It offers a spacious interior and a range of features.
First generation of the DS 3, known for its stylish design and customizable options.
Second generation, with updated styling and the introduction of an electric variant.

The SF90 Stradale is Ferrari's first plug-in hybrid electric vehicle (PHEV), combining a V8 engine with electric motors.

The fourth generation Leon features a more modern design, advanced technology, and a range of efficient engines, including plug-in hybrid options.
